H0.text: The modern 'science' of body language/kinesics was established in the. 1960's

H1.text: The modern 'science' of body language/kinesics was established in the. 1970's

H2.text: The modern 'science' of body language/kinesics was established in the. 1980's

H3.text: The modern 'science' of body language/kinesics was established in the. 50's

A4.text: Kinesics was first used in 1952 by an anthropologist named Ray Birdwhistell.

A5.text: Interest in kinesics specifically and nonverbal behaviour generally was popularized in the late 1960s and early 1970s by such popular mass-market (nonacademic) publications as How to Read a Person Like a Book.

A6.text: Birdwhistell's second book, Kinesics and Context, was published in 1970 and has been cited more often.

A7.text: Birdwhistell's work on the Natural History of an Interview project was conducted from 1960 to 1964.
